resources:
Off Bike Workouts Welcome! Created by Volunteer Professionals Download and Read on the go Available in different languages That anyone can freely translate and distribute. On a single day, designers, writers and illustrators meet to create cool books. On the bus, in a train, wherever you are - the books are there too. English, Zulu, Afrikaans, Xhosa and more! View Tutorial Example Skip FIN Welcome to Off Bike Workouts Main2Activity Home Dashboard Notifications Settings Hello World from section: %1$d Core Strech HIT Support Hello blank fragment A set of begginer workouts // You did it! Next up: %s %d seconds left Break! You did it! Touch to get back Scientific 7 minute workout Full body workout Please prepare Jumping jacks 1. Stand with feet together and arms at the sides
2. Jump to a position with the legs spread wide and the hands touching overhead
3. Repeat Wall sit 1. Lean against the wall with feet planted firmly on the ground, shoulders width apart and about 2 feet away from the wall
2. Slide down the wall, keeping the back pressed to it, until legs are at a right angle. The knees should be directly above the ankles

Quadricep pain is normal, stop if feeling pain in the knee or kneecap Push-ups 1. Lie down on your stomach
2. Place your hands near your ears
3. Use your arms to lift your stomach up until the arms are straight, keeping the back straight
4. Bend arms until chest almost touches the ground, making sure the back is straight
5. Repeat from step 3 Ab crunches 1. Lie down face up on the floor with knees bent.
2. Curl the shoulders towards the pelvis. The hands can be behind or beside the neck or crossed over the chest.
3. Repeat Step-ups 1. Stand facing a chair
2. Step up onto the chair
3. Step off the chair
4. Repeat Squats 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
2. Move the hips back and bend the knees and hips to lower the torso
3. Repeat Chair dips 1. Sit down on the front edge of a chair, back straight, hands holding the front edge
2. Still holding the edge of the chair, arms extended, lift your butt and walk forward slightly so that it is a few inches from the chair.
3. Slowly lower your body, keeping the back straight, until arms are at a right angle
4. Raise your body again to the previous position, arms extended
5. Repeat steps 3 and 4 Plank 1. Get down on all fours, with arms straight and knees bent
2. Walk your feet back until they are extended
3. Hold this position High knees 1. Run in place, putting knees as high up as is comfortable and switching legs at a quick pace Lunges 1. Stand with back straight
2. Take a large step forward with your left leg
3. Bring your pelvis down until you almost touch the floor with your right knee
4. Bring your pelvis back up
5. Return to standing position by stepping back
6. Repeat, switching legs each time Push-up rotations 1. Do a standard push-up:
1.a Lie down on your stomach
1.b Place your hands near your ears
1.c Use your arms to lift your stomach up until the arms are straight, keeping the back straight
1.d Bend arms until chest almost touches the ground, making sure the back is straight
1.e Lift your stomach up again, returning to step 3
2. Rotate your body to the side so that the back is straight, the bottom hand supporting the body is fully extended, and only the bottom hand and foot touch the floor
3. Repeat, changing sides at step 2 each time Side plank left 1. Lie down on your left side, with your bottom elbow at a right angle, arm sticking out
2. Lift your pelvis off the floor by lifting your bottom shoulder up, keeping the forearm on the floor; your head, pelvis, and feet should be in a straight line
3. Hold this position Side plank right 1. Lie down on your right side, with your bottom elbow at a right angle, arm sticking out
2. Lift your pelvis off the floor by lifting your bottom shoulder up, keeping the forearm on the floor; your head, pelvis, and feet should be in a straight line
3. Hold this position Start workout Tap for controls Resume workout Previous exercise Next exercise Navigate up Enable spoken commands Workouts Appears when a workout is in progress while the app is in the background %s (%d s.) Advanced 7 minute workout Reverse lunge with rotation Push-up to row to burpee Left-leg Romanian deadlift to curl to press Right-leg Romanian deadlift to curl to press Plank with arm lift Lateral lunge to overhead triceps extension Bent-over row No description yet. Contribute one at https://gitlab.com/enjoyingfoss/feeel Advanced 7 minute workouthahaha Streching lower DWDQWQW 0 lllllllll First plank start of easy ADD Interstitial Ad Sample Level 1 Next Level ca-app-pub-3940256099942544/1033173712 Post ride stretching OMG DELA Forward bend 1. Stand on the floor with your feet together
2. Then bend your body and try to touch your feet with your arms
3. Remember to exhale when stretching Forward bend left leg 1. Stand on the floor with your feet crossed right leg over left leg.
2. Then bend your body and try to touch your left foot with your arms
3. This helps to even both legs out
4. Remember to exhale when stretching Forward bend right leg 1. Stand on the floor with your feet crossed left leg over right leg.
2. Then bend your body and try to touch your left foot with your arms
3. This helps to even both legs out
4. Remember to exhale when stretching Left quad stretch with a wall 1. Stand with your right hand against the wall.
2. Bend your left leg and grasp your ankle or toes to bring your left calf close to your left thigh
3. Hold this position Right quad stretch with a wall 1. Stand with your left hand against the wall.
2. Bend your right leg and grasp your ankle or toes to bring your right calf close to your right thigh
3. Hold this position Calf stretch left 1. Stand one big step away in front of a wall.
2. Step forward with your right foot and push the wall with your hands
3. Make sure your left leg is fully extended and you feel the stretch Calf stretch right 1. Stand one big step away in front of a wall.
2. Step forward with your left foot and push the wall with your hands
3. Make sure your right leg is fully extended and you feel the stretch Splash Dummy Button DUMMY\nCONTENT
